s.text: To block the possible fee increase, 51% of property owners in the district must submit protest votes in writing.
"We can no longer do it for $20," said Alpaugh Irrigation board president Steve Martin.
Alpaugh residents may see their water fees triple to avoid losing service at the end of the month.
Sandra Meraz, Tulare County Water Works board president, interrupted an interview Tuesday when a screaming and crying farmworker arrived.
